concepts.term: square root of the sum of the squares

triples.evidence: First, there’s the intrinsic resolution of the gamma camera itself.
Second, the geometry of the collimator plays a major role.
Third, Compton scattering inside the patient adds another layer of uncertainty.
The overall resolution is then the square root of that sum.
triples.o: square root of the sum of the squares of the three main contributions

triples.evidence: The intrinsic spatial resolution of the gamma camera (excluding the collimator) Rgamma: This reflects the uncertainty in the exact location at which light is produced in the scintillation crystal. The degree of uncertainty is dictated by the thickness of the crystal and also by the intrinsic resolution of the Anger position encoder. The thicker the crystal, the broader is the light spread function (Section 1.5.3) and the poorer is the spatial resolution. A typical value of Rgamma lies in the range 3-5 mm.
triples.s: intrinsic resolution of the gamma camera

concepts.term: second, the geometry of the collimator plays a major role

evidence: The degree of uncertainty is dictated by the thickness of the crystal and also by the intrinsic resolution of the Anger position encoder.
triples.o: the intrinsic resolution of the Anger position encoder
triples.s: The intrinsic spatial resolution of the gamma camera

triples.evidence: A thicker crystal spreads the light more broadly, and that uncertainty shows up as blur in the final image.
triples.o: scintillation crystal and the electronics that localize the signal
